keyword: calories in reeses peanut butter cup
title: Calories in Reese's Peanut Butter Cup
meta_description: Discover calories in reeses peanut butter cup, including carbs, fat, protein, sodium, and quick tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in Reese's Peanut Butter Cup
assumptions: Standard single serving (approx. 9.5 g), milk chocolate with creamy peanut butter filling; values from typical product data.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, batch, and exact formulation. Check packaging for precise info.

quick_answer.text: One Reese's Peanut Butter Cup contains about 80 kcal, mostly from fat and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one Reese's peanut butter cup?
faqs.a: Approximately 80 kcal for a standard single cup.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in Reese's peanut butter cup?
faqs.a: About 9 g carbs, including 7.5 g sugars and 0.5 g fiber per cup.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a Reese's peanut butter cup?
faqs.a: 5 g total fat, with 2.5 g saturated fat per standard cup.

faqs.q: Does Reese's peanut butter cup have protein?
faqs.a: Yes, around 2 g protein per cup from the peanut butter.

faqs.q: How does size affect calories in Reese's peanut butter cups?
faqs.a: Minis have fewer calories (about 40 kcal each); king sizes have more (up to 180 kcal).
